name: Scaffold New Project in GitLab
description: Scaffolder app is used to create new software components from template repositories. It takes inputs from developers and generates a new repository or a PR based on the provided data and the template.

properties.content: This may take a few minutes to run depending on the size of the repository.

---
### Link to Generated GitLab Project

${triggerScaffoldNewServiceWorkflow.isLoading ? "Loading..." : 
    triggerScaffoldNewServiceWorkflow?.error ? 
        triggerScaffoldNewServiceWorkflow?.error : triggerScaffoldNewServiceWorkflow?.outputs?.workflowOutputs?.output_url}

*This is a Scaffolding template that can be used to instantiate new repositories or create PRs from templates*

>It comes with a pre-built integration that gets triggered whenever a user clicks **"Generate"**. Click **"Connection"** to configure your credentials with your source code provider.

>To customize the form, click **"Save"** and edit it. You can add your own input types to match your template repository.

>Set your template repository (org_name/repo_name) and path in the **"Workflow Inputs"**. Set your generated project repository name in the **"Workflow Inputs"** based on the inputs to the App.

> If you set create_repo to true, the workflow will create the new project repository and upload the template files. Otherwise, it will upload the template files to a branch and create a Pull Request for review.

>After updating your app with the desired fields, make sure they are passed to **"Template Variables"** in the Workflow Inputs as key value pairs.

>If you need to customize the Scaffolding Workflow, navigate to the **"Actions"** section to locate the workflow and customize it to suit your needs.

definition.name: Scaffold New Project in GitLab
